Articles.Content: Hello, i made side mounted liquid fuel tank, it works, but have incredibly high drag. I copied standard 0.2 0.3 drag values from similar stock parts, but still on low altitudes lower than 10 km i cant get over 50 m/s speed. Please help

I still cant figure out what is causing problems, i really need some help, please ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Here are some photos, as you can see shape of fuel tank is very aerodynamic, but drag is insane!

[![1431629276_e34c6b87a0-thumb.png](http://imgzone.ru/uploads/2015/05/14/thumb/1431629276_e34c6b87a0-thumb.png)](http://imgzone.ru/uploads/2015/05/14/1431629276_e34c6b87a0.png)

[![1431629304_8a36cb8c0c-thumb.png](http://imgzone.ru/uploads/2015/05/14/thumb/1431629304_8a36cb8c0c-thumb.png)](http://imgzone.ru/uploads/2015/05/14/1431629304_8a36cb8c0c.png)

Shifted over to Add On Development.

Good luck!

Need non-dark pics.

That said, the old KSP .90-and-below drag stats are utterly ignored in 1.0, so changing them won't do anything.

> 
> Need non-dark pics.
> That said, the old KSP .90-and-below drag stats are utterly ignored in 1.0, so changing them won't do anything.

What are "non dark pics"?

So in 1.0 how do drag is calculated?

Pics where I can see the part in question. It's in shadow in those pics.

See [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119108-Overhauls-for-1-0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119108-Overhauls-for-1-0) for how drag cubes work.

> 
> Pics where I can see the part in question. It's in shadow in those pics.
> See [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119108-Overhauls-for-1-0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119108-Overhauls-for-1-0) for how drag cubes work.

Well the drag are making side mounted fuel tanks, in bottom of them are stock [LV-T45 "Swivel" Liquid Fuel Engine](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/LV-T45_%22Swivel%22_Liquid_Fuel_Engine)
